title.rendered: Paraiso Miami Beach 2023 Presents an Unmissable Lineup of Must-See Shows

content.rendered:
Paraiso Miami Beach is set to return from June 8 to 11, bringing with it an impressive roster of top swimwear designers and exciting runway shows. The highly anticipated event will showcase the latest collections from renowned brands and introduce new names to the fashion scene. From sustainable swimwear benefiting Miami's coral reefs to the hottest Colombian brands and a unique coastal cowboy collection, this year's Paraiso Swim Week promises an unforgettable experience for fashion enthusiasts.

Returning designers include Azulu, ONEONE, Natasha Tonic, Lain Snow, and Luli Fama, known for their innovative designs and trend-setting styles. Joining them are newcomers SHAN, a luxury Canadian designer, and Curve, America's Largest Intimate Apparel Show. Additionally, two new brands, Axil Swimwear and Club L London, have been added to the impressive lineup.

The event will be held at the experiential tent constructed at Collins Park on Miami Beach, located at 2100 Collins Avenue. The runway shows will feature a diverse range of swim, lingerie, and resort brands, highlighting innovative design, inclusivity, diversity, and sustainability.

Lain Snow, a family-friendly swimwear brand from North Carolina, will kick off the festivities on Thursday, June 8 at 6:00 PM with their "Coastal Cowboy" collection. Designed for parents and kids who love to match, the collection combines Southern country style with Miami's tropical flair. Lain Snow's founder, Becca Ingle, draws inspiration from her own family, and her mission is to make all moms feel their best.

ONEONE, the 100% Colombian brand that turned heads last year, will showcase their latest collection, "#TBT," at 8:00 PM on the same day. This collection pays homage to vintage vibes while incorporating modern style elements. ONEONE is committed to sustainability and offers made-to-order production, reducing waste and utilizing recycled raw materials.

SHAN, the renowned Canadian resort wear company, will make its Swim Week runway debut on Saturday, June 10 at 4:00 PM. Known for its elegant designs, SHAN's latest collection is inspired by warm weather, sandy beaches, and lush coastal regions. The brand has boutiques in top cities and will release the new collection in November.

Saturday, June 10 will also feature Curve, the largest lingerie trade show in North America, presenting its debut runway show at 6:00 PM. Over 10 designers, including Anita, Chantelle, and Wacoal, will showcase their latest lingerie, swimwear, and activewear designs. Curve aims to celebrate beauty, comfort, and confidence in all body forms, and this inaugural show in Miami highlights the city's growing importance in the intimate apparel industry.

Luli Fama, a Miami-based luxury swim and resort wear brand, will close out Saturday night at 8:30 PM with their latest collection, "Puerto Luli." Known for its flattering fit and vibrant designs, Luli Fama's new line draws inspiration from the Caribbean islands, capturing the essence of tropical paradise and the energy of Miami.

On Saturday, June 10 at 10:00 PM, Club L London, a leading online fashion retailer from the UK, will launch its latest resort collection, "Destination Daze & Tequila Sunset." The collection features contemporary and stylish designs in a wide range of inclusive sizes and affordable price points, inspired by exotic destinations and the tropical energy of summer nights.

Sunday, June 11 at 6:00 PM - Swimwear designer Natasha Toni debuts her latest collection "Coral City" at Paraiso Miami Swim Week 2023. The collection raises awareness about coral reef dangers and donates 10% of sales to Coral Morphologic and an Indonesian non-profit. For each swimsuit purchased, a coral will be planted on Bali's reefs. 

Sunday, June 11 at 7:00 PM - AZULU presents the "Porto" collection inspired by Portugal at Paraiso Miami Swim Week. The line showcases modern silhouettes, prints, and details connected to the sea culture. The ready-to-wear pieces use breathable fabrics, while sustainable materials are used for swimwear. See-now-buy-now pieces available at Brickell City Center and Aventura Mall.

Sunday, June 11 at 8:00 PM - Axil Swim reveals a vibrant collection representing different eras at Paraiso Miami Swim Week. Each line captures a distinct mood, empowering wearers to express themselves. The see-now, buy-now collection blends metallics, prints, and versatile designs.

PARAISO Miami Beach ( A.K.A. Swim Fashion Week ) is the worlds largest marketing event for the Swimwear and Resort Wear industry. A multi-day fashion fair is widely known as Miami Swim Week and promotes a comprehensive calendar which includes Miami Swim Week produced experiential events, leading trade shows, and satellite programs that support emerging and independent designers. Buy tickets here.
